svt_i2c_slave Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_i2c_slave:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class is UVM Driver that implements an I2C slave component. The events available at the slave driver are as follows :

  • EVENT_START_DETECTED : signals START detection by slave
  • EVENT_STOP_DETECTED : signals STOP detection by slave
  • EVENT_ACK_RECEIVED : signals ACK received by slave
  • EVENT_NACK_RECEIVED : signals NACK received by slave
  • EVENT_ACK_GENERATED : signals ACK generated from slave
  • EVENT_NACK_GENERATED : signals NACK generated from slave
EVENT_SECOND_BYTE_GEN_CALL_ACK_GENERATED : signals ACK for second byte of general call by slave

 protected function void
 svt_i2c_slave::post_seq_item_get
 (  svt_i2c_slave_transaction xact , ref bit drop  ) 

Callback issued after pulling a transaction descriptor out of its input TLM port, but before acting on the transaction descriptor in any way.

xact - A reference to the transaction descriptor object of interest.

drop - A ref argument, which if set by the user's callback implementation causes the component to discard the transaction descriptor without further action

 virtual task
 svt_i2c_slave::try_receive_frame
 (   ) 

This function is of NO relevance for pure simulation environment. This function is needed only for SVT-XTOR environment. For ZCEI XTORS *txrx.uvm will keep polling this function and checking whether XTOR has received any packet.

 svt_i2c_slave::EVENT_TX_XACT_CONSUMED

Event triggers when slave driver consumes the transaction object. At this point, transaction object is not yet processed or transmitted on the bus.
